entry.title: NSA leaker Edward Snowden seeks return to US, on his terms
entry.summary: Whistleblower Edward Snowden remains in hiding two years after the revelations.

entry.title: German spy chief sees reason to thank Snowden
entry.summary:
BERLIN (AP) - Germany's domestic intelligence chief said Tuesday that the revelations by Edward Snowden have had at least one positive effect, by raising awareness about the importance of counter-espionage.

"So maybe one can be grateful to Snowden that he has put a spotlight on the issue of counter-espionage in Germany," dpa quoted Maassen as saying.

Although the reports didn't explicitly cite documents leaked to the media by Snowden, they came amid a flurry of similar claims about alleged U.S. surveillance in Germany that were linked to the former NSA contractor.

entry.title: DOJ: No change in stance on Snowden
entry.summary: "This is an ongoing case so I am not going to get into specific details," she said, "but I can say our position regarding bringing Edward Snowden back to the United States to face charges has not changed."

entry.title: Jeb Bush: No leniency for Edward Snowden
Jeb Bush Is Strongly Opposed to Edward Snowdenâ€™s Theoretical Homecoming
entry.summary: Snowden broke the law, recklessly endangered nat'l security, & fled to China/Russia.

entry.title: Eric Holder: Edward Snowden Might Return to U.S.
entry.summary: Eric Holder: Edward Snowden Might Return to U.S.

entry.title: Justice Dept. could strike deal with Edward Snowden upon US return - Eric Holder
entry.summary:
The former head of the Justice Department said the "possibility exists" for a deal to allow whistleblower Edward Snowden to return to the US.

Melanie Newman, chief spokeswoman for Attorney General Loretta Lynch, Holder's successor, immediately shot down the idea that the Justice Department was softening its stance on Snowden.

entry.title: Holder sees possible DOJ deal with Snowden
entry.summary: "We are in a different place as a result of the Snowden disclosures."

entry.title: Freedom for Snowden, metric system for America: Chafee leaves some NH Democrats a bit puzzled
entry.summary:
Chafee told the group he wants to bring National Security Agency leaker Edward Snowden home, dropping all charges against him.

Paula Trombi of Meredith said she liked some of what he said but was taken aback and disappointed by his position on Snowden.

Dave Pollak, chairman of Belknap County Democrats, said he agreed with Chafee that Snowden is a whistleblower and should not be prosecuted.

entry.title: France mulls offering asylum to Julian Assange and Edward Snowden
entry.summary:
"If France decides to offer asylum to Edward Snowden and Julian Assange, I wouldn't be surprised. It's a possibility," Ms Taubira said in a television interview.

Although WikiLeaks has not indicated the source of the leaked material, the disclosures suggest the group has obtained access to the massive trove of intelligence material leaked by Mr Snowden in May 2013 or else other US intelligence material of similar sensitivity and importance.
